column1: Timashyovsk (Russian: Тимашёвск) is a town and the administrative center of Timashyovsky District of Krasnodar Krai
column3: located on the Kirpili River 73 kilometers (45 mi) north of Krasnodar
column4: the administrative center of the krai. As of the 2010 Census

column1: It was founded in 1794 and was granted town status in 1966.

column3: 21 Jews were shot in the sovkhoze “Timachevets”. Seven other Jews were arrested in the hamlet Proletary and taken to there in order to be killed. According to the Extraordinary Soviet Commission
column4: 75 Jews were shot in August 1942 in this location by an Einsatzgruppen.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Timashyovsk serves as the administrative center of Timashyovsky District. As an administrative division
column4: together with one rural locality (the settlement of Kirpichny)
column5: incorporated within Timashyovsky District as the Town of Timashyovsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Timashyovsk is incorporated within Timashyovsky Municipal District as Timashyovskoye Urban Settlement.
